docs.title: Unit One : Numbers and operations on them
exercise One : Proportion
docs.text:
1. Complete the following:
    1. The proportion is an equality of at least two ratios or two rates
    2. If two ratios are equal, then the product of the extremes = Means
    3. $$ \frac{X}{15} = \frac{3}{5} $$

docs.title: Unit One : Numbers and operations on them
Ratio
docs.text:
A ratio is a method of comparing two quantity of the same kind

expresses the relationship between a part and a part, a part and a whole, or a whole and a part

docs.title: Forms
docs.text:
1. $$\frac{a}{b}$$
  2. a : b
  3. a to b

docs.title: Example 1
docs.text: your class in school has 50 students, 30 boys, and 20 girls. Write the ratio between the following 1. the number of boys to the total number in class 2. the number of girls to the number of boys 3. the total number of students to the number of girls

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
1. the number of boys to the total number in class $$ \frac{30}{50} $$
  2. the number of girls to the number of boys $$ \frac{20}{30} $$
  3. the total number of students to the number of girls $$ \frac{50}{20} $$

docs.title: Equivalent Ratio
docs.text: ببساطه يا حج سيف بضرب البسط والمقام في نفس الرقم او قسمت البسط والمقام على نفس الرقم

docs.title: Example 2
docs.text:
1. write two equivalent to $$ \frac{16}{24} $$
  2. if $\frac{6}{X}$ = $\frac{3}{4}$, what is the value of X?

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
1. write two equivalent to $$ \frac{16}{24} $$
    • Multiply: $$ \frac{16×2}{24×2}=\frac{32}{48} $$
    • Divide: $$ \frac{16÷8}{24÷8}=\frac{2}{3} $$
  2. if $$\frac{6}{X}=\frac{3}{4}$$, what is the value of X? $$ X=\frac{4×6}{3}=\frac{24}{3}=8$$

docs.title: Simplest form
docs.text: تكرار عمليه القسمه على البسط والمقام على نفس الرقم لغاية لما يبه مينفعش اقسم البسط والمقام تاني على نفس الرقم

docs.title: Example 3
docs.text: Write the simplest form of the ratio 1. $$\frac{30}{20}$$

docs.title: Rate
docs.text: it is compares two quantities with different unit of measurement

docs.title: Example :
docs.text: 1. 180 Kilometers in 3 hours

docs.title: Soultion
docs.text: Simplifying the fraction til it has denominator equal 1 $$ \frac{180 Kilometers}{3hours}=\frac{180÷3}{3÷3}=\frac{60 Kilometers}{1 hours} $$

docs.title: Are you Ready?
docs.text:
1. Write each of the following ratio in simplest form:
    1. 48 : 16
    2. 14 to 35
    3. $$\frac{48}{40}$$
    4. 50 : 75

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
1.

$$ \frac{48}{16} = \frac{48÷8}{16÷8} = \frac{6}{2} = \frac{6÷2}{2÷2} = \frac{3}{1}=3 $$ 2. $$ \frac{14}{35} = \frac{14÷7}{35÷7} = \frac{2}{5} $$ 3. $$ \frac{48}{40} = \frac{48 \div 4}{40 \div 4} = \frac{12}{10} = \frac{12 \div 2}{10 \div 2} = \frac{6}{5} $$ 4. $$ \frac{50}{75} = \frac{50 \div 5}{75 \div 5} = \frac{10}{15} = \frac{10 \div 5}{15 \div 5} = \frac{2}{3} $$

  1. In one of the training, Ahmed secored 8 goals out of 10 attempts, While Saif scored 3 goals out of 5 attempts. Are the two ratios equivalent?

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
1. Ahmed Scored ratio

$$ \frac{8}{10} $$ 2. Saif Scored ratio $$ \frac{3}{5} $$ > علشان نتاكد هما متساويين والا لاه يا سيف لازم نوحد المقامات يعني ممكن نضرب البسط والمقام الصغير في نفس الرقم علشان يوصل للرقم الكبير او نقسم البسط والمقام في الرقم الكبير علشان يوصل للرقم الصغير

$$ \frac{8÷2}{10÷2}=\frac{4}{5} $$ OR $$ \frac{3×2}{5×2}=\frac{6}{10} $$

بعد توحيد المقامات نقارن البسط

$$ \frac{8}{10} \frac{6}{10} $$

كده البسط عند احمد اكبر لانه بيساوي 8 وعند سيف بيساوي 6 يبقه انا اللي كسبت وكده النسبتين مش متساوين

the two ratio is not equivalent

docs.title: Concept of Proportion
docs.text: A proportion is an equality of at least two ratios or two rates

docs.title: Example
docs.text: (equality of two ratios) $$\frac{4}{8} = \frac{1}{2}$$ (Equality of two rates) $$\frac{8 eggs}{2 Cups of flour} = \frac{4 eggs}{1 cup of flour}$$

docs.title: Writing Proportion
docs.text:
if the quantities a, b, c, and d are proportional quantities,and vice versa then $$ \frac{a}{b} = \frac{c}{d} $$

a, and d named Extremes b, and c named Means

docs.title: بالعربي
docs.text:
يعني لما يقولك ان الارقام دي proportion يعني نسب ده معناه ان البسط في الكسر الاول والمقام بتاع الكسر التاني اسمهم الاطراف المقام في الكسر الاول والبسط بتاع الكسر التاني اسمهم الوسائط

a : b : c : d

docs.title: Prperty of Cross Multiplication
docs.text:
if two ratios are equal, you will find that: Product of Extremes = Product of Means

if $$\frac{a}{b}=\frac{c}{d}$$ then: a × d = b × c

docs.title: Example 2
docs.text:
Determine which of the following pairs of ratios represents a proportion

  1. $$ \frac{3}{8}, \frac{6}{10} $$
  2. $$ \frac{8}{10}, \frac{12}{15} $$

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
if the product of the extremes equals the products of means, then this pairs of ratios represent a proportio 1. $$\frac{3}{8}, \frac{12}{15}$$ 3 × 10 = 30 Extremes

6 × 8 = 48 Means

product of Extremes ≠ product of Means these ratio do not represent a proportion

  1. $$\frac{8}{10}, \frac{12}{15}$$

8 × 15 = 120

12 × 10 = 120

these ratios represent a proportion

docs.title: Example 3
docs.text: solve each of the following proportion 1. $$ \frac{4}{12} = \frac{20}{X} $$

docs.title: Graphical Representation of proportion
docs.text: • if the plotted point lie on a straight line passing through the origin, then the relationship represents a proportion يعني لما احط كل النقط على الرسمه واوصلهم ببعض يوصلوا لنقطه الصفر يبقه كده الارقام دي بتعبر عن proporation

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
The two tables below show the distance in kilometere covered by a car. Determine graphically the relation between the distance and time, determine whether the distance in kilometers is proportional to the time in hours 1. Covered Distances

Time(hours) Distance (Km) 1 70 2 140 3 210 4 280
  1. Covered Distances
Time(hours) Distance (Km) 1 80 2 100 3 190 4 260

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
1. Table one
  1. Table 2
